title: Police charge Aiken man after he shoots roommate
content:
The Aiken County Sheriff’s Office charged an Aiken man this week after police said he accidentally shot his 49-year-old roommate outside of their Barway Drive home.
Harry Syndor Willis Jr., 66, is charged with assault and battery of a high and aggravated nature and possession of a weapon during a violent crime, according to jail records.
According to a police report, deputies responded to Aiken Regional Medical Centers around 10:30 p.m. Wednesday, where Willis said when he was inside of his home, he saw a man climb over his fence, prompting him to get his shotgun.
Willis told police he stepped outside to yell at the man to stop, and when the man didn't, he fired one shot, the report said.
Upon closer inspection, Willis told deputies he realized he had shot his roommate by mistake, then rushed the roommate to the hospital, police reported.
A deputy reported investigators were not able to speak with the victim immediately following the incident due to his medical condition.
When the victim became well, the victim told police he wanted to press charges against Willis, according to the report.
Willis was arrested Monday and taken to the Aiken County detention center, where he remained Tuesday.
Bond information for Willis was not immediately available.
Tripp Girardeau is the crime and courts reporter with the Aiken Standard. Follow him on Twitter at @trippgirardeau.
